definition: to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)

sentences.english: 9-2. In those days wandering minstrels were welcome everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 當時，浪跡四方的吟遊歌手到處受歡迎。

sentences.english: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.
sentences.chinese: 所有能夠阻擋妖精吟遊詩人的生物皆須阻擋之。

sentences.english: Bards will not spare breath upon your pitiful empire.
sentences.chinese: 吟遊詩人將不會在你那可鄙的王朝上多費口舌。

sentences.english: Alistair: You know, I've heard about the Orlesian bards.
sentences.chinese: 其實，我是有聽過些奧爾雷西恩吟遊詩人的傳聞。

sentences.english: OK, where is the streaking Minstrel?We've got to put an end to this.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，那個裸奔的吟遊詩人在哪？我們得把這事擺平。

sentences.english: The minstrel has been to many places before he came here.
sentences.chinese: 在來到這裏之前，這個吟遊詩人已經去過很多地方。

sentences.english: He is often called England's national poet and the "Bard of Avon".
sentences.chinese: 他被譽爲英國的民族詩人和“吟遊詩人”。

sentences.english: The minstrel had been to many places before he came here.
sentences.chinese: 在來到這裏之前，這個吟遊詩人已經去過很多地方。

sentences.english: Cracktooth can be summoned by a Minstrel on a class quest.
sentences.chinese: 在職業任務中，通過吟遊詩人可以召喚裂牙。

sentences.english: Oh, I'm a bard that kind of stuff comes naturally.
sentences.chinese: 哦，我是個吟遊詩人，這種話很自然地就冒出來了。

sentences.english: They survived, indeed, in Europe as the minstrels into the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 他們在歐洲的確是作爲吟遊詩人而留存到中世紀的。

sentences.english: In those days wandering minstrels were welcome everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 當時，浪跡天涯的吟遊歌手到處受歡迎。

sentences.english: This is Frost in old age, as an American bard from a magazine.
sentences.chinese: 這張是他年老時，一個雜誌上的吟遊詩人。

sentences.english: See Bardic Music in the bard class description.
sentences.chinese: 見吟遊詩人職業說明中吟唱能力。

sentences.english: Bards can now gain the Blade Master discipline.
sentences.chinese: 吟遊詩人現在得到劍術掌握了。
